alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 27 at 1:20PM MST until February 28 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO WINDY AND VERY DRY CONDITIONS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH 6 PM MST TUESDAY EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO VERY WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS... .Westerly downslope winds will persist across eastern New Mexico today in the wake of yesterday`s storm system, but speeds will be much lower. However, winds and relative humidity will exceed critical threshold across the east-central plains today. Winds will strengthen Tuesday across much of the area and the combination of very windy and dry conditions will bring several hours of critical fire weather conditions to the eastern plains. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 6 PM MST Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...For the warning, East Central Plains (Zone 126) from 11 AM this morning through 6 PM MST this evening. For the watch, East Central Plains (Zone 126) from Tuesday late morning through Tuesday early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph today. West 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent today and Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning and Fire Weather Watch.
